body_content.explanation: ruling at the present time or at a particular time, or relating to the period when a king, queen, etc. is ruling :
examples: Mary, Queen of Scots was Scottish queen regnant from 14 December 1542 to 24 July 1567.
I did hear once that Prince Charles is considering taking as his regnant name as King George VII.

body_content.explanation: having the most influence at the present time or at a particular time :
examples: That is the ideology that is regnant in France.
Failure to meet the psychological needs of the developing child can be a regnant cause of personality disorders.
